title: Fong Clinical Risk Score for Colorectal Cancer Recurrence
description: Predicts recurrence and survival risk for colorectal cancer patients with liver metastases after hepatic resection. Developed from analysis of 1,001 consecutive cases to identify high-risk patients who may benefit from adjuvant therapy or closer surveillance.

parameters.name: node_positive_primary
parameters.description: Node-positive primary tumor (lymph node involvement at primary site)

parameters.name: disease_free_interval
parameters.description: Disease-free interval from primary tumor resection to liver metastasis detection

ranges.interpretation: 5-year survival rate approximately 60%. Lowest risk group with best prognosis after hepatic resection.
5-year survival rate approximately 44%. Favorable outcome expected after hepatic resection.
5-year survival rate approximately 30%. Acceptable outcome with potential benefit from hepatic resection.
5-year survival rate approximately 16%. Consider experimental adjuvant therapy or alternative treatment strategies.
5-year survival rate approximately 11%. Strong consideration for experimental adjuvant therapy or systemic treatment.
5-year survival rate approximately 14%. Highest risk group requiring aggressive adjuvant therapy consideration.

references: Fong Y, Fortner J, Sun RL, Brennan MF, Blumgart LH. Clinical score for predicting recurrence after hepatic resection for metastatic colorectal cancer: analysis of 1001 consecutive cases. Ann Surg. 1999;230(3):309-318.
Mala T, Bohler G, Mathisen O, Bergan A, Soreide O. Hepatic resection for colorectal metastases: can preoperative scoring predict patient outcome? World J Surg. 2002;26(11):1348-1353.

Mann CD, Metcalfe MS, Leopardi LN, Maddern GJ. The clinical risk score: emerging as a reliable preoperative prognostic index in hepatectomy for colorectal metastases. Arch Surg. 2004;139(11):1168-1172.

Nordlinger B, Guiguet M, Vaillant JC, et al. Surgical resection of colorectal carcinoma metastases to the liver. A prognostic scoring system to improve case selection, based on 1568 patients. Cancer. 1996;77(7):1254-1262.
formula: Sum of points: Node-positive primary (1 point) + Disease-free interval <12 months (1 point) + Multiple tumors (1 point) + CEA >200 ng/mL (1 point) + Largest tumor >5 cm (1 point)
notes: Developed from analysis of 1,001 consecutive patients undergoing hepatic resection for colorectal liver metastases at Memorial Sloan-Kettering Cancer Center (1985-1998)
Not intended to exclude patients from surgery but to stratify risk and guide treatment decisions
Patients with scores 0-2 have favorable outcomes and should be considered for resection
Patients with scores â‰¥3 should be considered for experimental adjuvant therapy
The score helps predict both overall survival and disease-free survival
Useful for patient counseling, surveillance planning, and clinical trial stratification
Validated in multiple independent cohorts and remains widely used despite advances in systemic therapy
